page.title: 07A FORESTRY CONTRACTOR'S DAY
page.content: I start work at 7.30 by delivering fuel to the machines,inspecting for damage and carrying out any necessary repairs.My employees are felling trees using a chain saw ready for the Kockum 82.54"Processor" This 120 H.P. machine costs Â£130,000.It picks up the tree and strips off the branches,cross- cutting into selected lengths by means of the sophisticated measuring system built into the machine.The piles of wood left by the Processor in the forest are dealt with by a second machine,a Gremo 1004"Forwarder"costing Â£90,000,also 120 H.P.which picks up the wood piles and carries them to the forest road,about 10 tonnes at a time, stacks the logs ready for transport by the haulage contractors.Both machines run on diesel fuel,and use about 20 gallons per day each machine.I usually finish work about 6 o'clock.
